comments:
Building a simple EMF model from Annotated Java based on the library example.
Added a couple of interfaces with @model markers. Began the model generation
wizard. On the screen where the method of generating the model is selected,
chose Generate from Annotated Java, clicked "Next" button - nothing happened.
The following exception was written to .log:

This problem occurred in the latest (2.1.0.200506020944) version of EMF under
the latest version of Eclipse 3.1 following an upgrade from an earlier EMF
version via the update manager.

I did verify that the same procedure works in the earlier version (2.1.0), so it
seems that this problem was introduced in a recent build. While this issue is
holding me up from my current project, I have a workaround in using the earlier
version, so I've left the severity as normal. 

I can provide additional information about my configuration as needed to help
find the problem, but it looks like it should be easy to fix.

This is our first build using MANIFEST.MF files.  Can you restart Eclipse with
the -clean option and try this again?

(In reply to comment #1)
> This is our first build using MANIFEST.MF files.  Can you restart Eclipse with
> the -clean option and try this again?

I tried restarting with -clean - no change to the problem.

I did some additional investigation. The class that is missing
(org/eclipse/jface/dialogs/IPageChangedListener) is not contained in the version
of jface.jar (3.1.0) in my plugins folder. I don't know if this means I'm
running an incompatible version of jface, but it may help in troubleshooting the
problem.

I am using Eclipse RC1 and the interface is available in
eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.jface_3.1.0.jar.  Also, I've checked the Eclipse cvs
repository and the file has not being deleted.

Maybe something went wrong when you were downloading or expanding the Eclipse
compressed file.

I will close this defect.  Feel free to open it again (although we will probably
end up assigning it to the UI team if it is actually a "class not found" issue).

(In reply to comment #4)

I rechecked both the current build and the earlier one that works. The interface
is definitely not in either one, but appears not to have been used in the
earlier version (or I surmise as much since it is working). The file you mention
is named differently than mine, though, so that may be part of the issue.

Mine is at C:\Eclipse3.1\plugins\org.eclipse.jface_3.1.0\jface.jar, dated
4/6/05, size is 670,370 bytes.

Could this be an issue with the eclipse update process?

Which Eclipse build are you using?  The IPageChangedListener was created on
21/March/2005 due to the reasons described in the bugzilla 87111.

(In reply to comment #6)

I am using 3.1.0 build I20050219-1500, which is older than the change you
mentioned above. I have been keeping it up to date with Update Manager, but that
apparently doesn't pick up platform changes? I'm reclosing the bug. Thanks for
the help!
